intro: Ourisia lactea subsp. lactea, commonly known as the white-flowered ourisia, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring, often arranged in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and covered in a fine, white pubescence. The species is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
